title: Add Variable to double strange behavior
body_html:
See the example below

>>> double = np.array([0.0], dtype=np.float64)[0]
>>> float = 0.0
>>> a = Variable(torch.FloatTensor(1))
>>> a + float
Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
>>> float + a
Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
>>> a + double
Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
>>> double + a
array([[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]], dtype=object)
body_text:
See the example below
>>> double = np.array([0.0], dtype=np.float64)[0]
>>> float = 0.0
>>> a = Variable(torch.FloatTensor(1))
>>> a + float
Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
>>> float + a
Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
>>> a + double
Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
>>> double + a
array([[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]], dtype=object)
body:
See the example below

```
>>> double = np.array([0.0], dtype=np.float64)[0]
>>> float = 0.0
>>> a = Variable(torch.FloatTensor(1))
>>> a + float
Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
>>> float + a
Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
>>> a + double
Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
>>> double + a
array([[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[Variable containing:
1.00000e-34 *
  1.3192
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]
]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]]], dtype=object)
```
